Notes.Text:
This update for python-Authlib fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2025-61920: limited the size of the header to prevent DoS (bsc#1251921).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Python 3 15 SP6
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Python 3 15 SP7

Vulnerabilities.Description: Authlib is a Python library which builds OAuth and OpenID Connect servers. Prior to version 1.6.5, Authlib's JOSE implementation accepts unbounded JWS/JWT header and signature segments. A remote attacker can craft a token whose base64url-encoded header or signature spans hundreds of megabytes. During verification, Authlib decodes and parses the full input before it is rejected, driving CPU and memory consumption to hostile levels and enabling denial of service. Version 1.6.5 patches the issue. Some temporary workarounds are available. Enforce input size limits before handing tokens to Authlib and/or use application-level throttling to reduce amplification risk.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Python 3 15 SP6:python311-Authlib-1.3.1-150600.3.6.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Python 3 15 SP7:python311-Authlib-1.3.1-150600.3.6.1
